citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There is a pile of at least a dozen loose screws sitting on the edge of the peacock enclosure. Some of these screws are
sticking into the enclosure and at least two have fallen into the dirt inside the enclosure where the animals can access
them.
Inappropriate items, such as leftover construction materials, can lead to injury or ingestion if animals gain access to them.
Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings, surrounding grounds, and exhibit areas, must be kept
clean and in good repair in order to protect the birds from injury and disease. Premises must be kept free of
accumulations of trash, junk, waste products, and discarded matter.
To be corrected by September 15, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.158(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There is a pile of at least a dozen loose screws sitting on the edge of the peacock enclosure. Some of these screws are 
sticking into the enclosure and at least two have fallen into the dirt inside the enclosure where the animals can access 
them.  
Inappropriate items, such as leftover construction materials, can lead to injury or ingestion if animals gain access to them. 
Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings, surrounding grounds, and exhibit areas, must be kept 
clean and in good repair in order to protect the birds from injury and disease. Premises must be kept free of 
accumulations of trash, junk, waste products, and discarded matter.  
To be corrected by September 15, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
